original: KABLBEBG, Bobert, Civilingenjör, Hallstavik, f Vimmerby 26/11 92 av garverifabr C E G K o Ida Sundin, gm Margareta Hansson. Studex Lund 11, fil kand 15, tillf stud KTH 15—16, ord stud 16—17 (kemi). Anst v Sthlms Superfosfatfabr AB i Ljungaverk 17, Holmens Bruks & Fabr AB i Norrkp 17—28, v samma bol:s pappersbr i Hallstavik fr-28, ing f sul-fitfabr o ch.kemist, tillika vkst dir o styr.led i Kemiska Kontrollbyrån o Vimmerby Läder-fabr AB (grund av fadern i början av 90-talet und namn Lindekulla Garveri v Vimmerby, överlåt på barnen o ombild t fam.bol 18). Sekr i Sv Pappersbruksfrns kté f industriellt avloppsvatten. Fd besiktn.man f motorfordon h Sv Automobiltariff-frn. Led av kommunal-flm, kyrkoflm, folksk.styr mm i Häverö. Styr.led i hemv.kretsnmd o Hallstaviks Luftsk.frn, luftskyddsled v Hallstaviks pappersbruk. Ordf i N Roslags Skyttekrets, styr.suppl i Sthlms Läns Skyttefrb, v. ordf i Hallstaviks Skytte-frn. Fd ordf i Sv Motorklubbens östgötaavd o styr.led i klubbens centralstyr. Resor: Tyskl 20 26 o 32, Frankr 20 o 26, Engl, USA o Canada 23 o 31, Ryssl 30, Ital 32, Norge, Danm o Finl uppr ggr. Av trycket: Luftfuktighetens inverkan v fuktighetsbestämn å papper (25), Om pH-kontroll v pappersbruk (29), Slemavsättningar i cellulosa- o pappers-fabriker samt deras bekämp m klor eller klor-amin mm (34), Om frisyratorn o likn anordn v sulfitsyraberedningen (42). Frimurare. Riks-luftsk.frbs ftjt. Hobby: Skytte.
translated: KABLBEBG, Bobert, Civil Engineer, Hallstavik, b. Vimmerby 26/11 92, son of tannery factory owners C E G K and Ida Sundin, married to Margareta Hansson. Graduated from Lund University in 1911 with a Bachelor's degree in Philosophy. Temporary studies at KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in 1915-1916, regular studies in 1916-1917 (Chemistry). Employed at Stockholm Superphosphate Works AB in Ljungaverk in 1917, Holmens Bruks & Fabr AB in Norrköping in 1917-1928, and at the paper mill of the same company in Hallstavik from 1928 onwards, as an engineer in the sulfite factory and a chemist, also serving as the deputy director and board member. Additionally, he served as secretary at the Swedish Pulp and Paper Industry Association for industrial wastewater. Former inspector of motor vehicles for the Swedish Automobile Tariff Association. Member of the municipal film committee, church film committee, and the public school board in Häverö. Board member of the local civil defense council and Hallstavik Air Defense Association, air defense leader at the Hallstavik paper mill. Chairman of the Northern Roslagen Shooting District, board substitute in the Stockholm County Shooting Federation, vice chairman of the Hallstavik Shooting Association. Former chairman of the Swedish Motor Club's Östergötland branch and board member of the club's central board. Travel: Germany in 1920, 1926, and 1932, France in 1920 and 1926, England, USA, and Canada in 1923 and 1931, Russia in 1930, Italy in 1932, multiple trips to Norway, Denmark, and Finland. Publications: The effect of humidity on paper moisture determination (1925), pH control in paper mills (1929), slime deposition in cellulose and paper factories and their control using chlorine or chloramine, etc. (1934), hairdryer and similar devices for sulfite acid preparation (1942). Freemason. National air defense medal. Hobby: Shooting.
